page.title: 12FARMING
page.content: The country side around Stratford is peaceful and rolling.Much of it is intensively farmed.We visited two farms in our block,one very close to Stratford and the other out in the countryside. Hines House Farm: They had 98.04 acres of land.They specilised in arable food.They did not have any animals apart from a little dog.They had alot of machinary because they specilised in cereals like oats, corn and wheat.Hines House means the home of the Monks retreat from the Abbey. Cross-O-The-Hill Farm: Cross-O- The-Hill Farm had one hundred and forty acres of land.They specialise in vegetables.They have a helper on the farm and when it is harvesting time they could have up-to twenty helpers. They kept twenty-five cattle for meat. They grow salad stuff and vegetables. They also grow barley and wheat.
